page.title: 15Health_Water
page.content: We visited Saltersford water treatment plant to study,how the water of the Witham is treated to make it drinkable.Saltersford does in fact take water from two other sources as well as the river Witham.They are Cringle brook( a stream originating from the Stoke Rochford area) and Rutland water. LIsa O'boyle 1m."First we saw the large reservoir which holds 7 million gallons of water.It is pumped to the main treatment building where it is screened and chlorine is added.It then goes through a super pulsator,which takes out the small particles.It then passes through 6 filters.After this the water is drinkable and is pumped to three storage reservoirs around Grantham.We were shown the safety equipment in the event of a chlorine leak."
